CONSTRUCTION WORK
Career Overview
Highly skilled in working with people.
Main course of work has been in the Construction area but computers were also a big asset to my knowledge as running a business requires the use of a computer and skills as many other things.
Qualifications
Strong analytical skills Project management Strong collaborative skills Document management
Testing Excellent problem solving skills Customer needs assessment

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Leadership

Project Management
Managed complex projects, facilitating acquisition of business requirements. Prepared specifications, developed reporting and analytics Website Design
Website Design
Created accent graphics, banner ads, icons, animations and logos using WordPress.
Client Interface
Collaborated on client engagement strategy to drive entry into risk-driven project methodology, improving accuracy of project definition, sizing estimates, and resource budget planning.
Improved client relationships and project predictability through shared business and technical perspectives, agreed project roles, risk assessment, use cases, transparent business-aligned development efforts, and time-boxed delivery.
Team Collaboration
Initiated development team evolution strategy and deployed best practices, such as team building, hard work development and repeatable builds.
Defined project skill sets in line with methodology and drove training.

Each day I come to my office and get the work orders that I can complete that day.
I plan each day accordingly so that I am efficient as possible.
I drive to job sites and do very professional type of work.
Interacting with neighbors happens daily so I have learned to interact in a very professional type of way, answering any questions they have but also not giving out too much information.
Doing work with buildings plays a major role because I have to winterize the houses.

Problem-solving skills are used daily.
Accomplishments I have earned the trust of my contractor.
I have increased the number of jobs I take each day because of the efficiency I have learned.
Meeting with certain people and providing access to homes has become a large portion of my work so I have made many business partners.
The network of people I knew in this field has grew over these two years and I am very proud of that.
Skills Used Problem solving is a big part of my job! I use it daily.
Efficiency is used daily and i am proud to say I have acquired this skill.
Interacting with business partners, neighbors, and anyone who has any questions is also a skill i have learned, from calling people and setting up appointments, to evicting people out of foreclosed homes.

We came to the job site early to get as much work done as possible.
We would paint and then when we would make it back to the job site a different day after the paint would dry, we would usually install the mill work.
Accomplishments I acquired friends and business partners during this job.
I would see many people that we did business with and very often they would recommend us to their friends and family.
I also learned how to be very careful with the work that I do as paint cant be easily washed off or changed.
I learned to do it right the first time.
Skills Used Doing everything carefully was the key to this job.
Being very friendly with the crew and with the people we were doing business for was also a big deal.
I learned about the way houses are built and how to treat different parts of the houses and buildings differently.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Manager - WWTP - URGENTLT HIRING

Location: West Virginia, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Overview

Our client, an industry-leading construction company, is seeking an experienced Project Manager for Water and Wastewater Treatment Plant projects. As a 100% employee-owned company, our client offers a dynamic and results-oriented atmosphere where employees share in the company's success and profits.

Duties And Responsibilities

Oversee project development, ensuring timely delivery within scope and budget.Supervise project buyout in collaboration with the estimator.Manage submittals and the RFI process.Lead planning and progress meetings, creating agendas and executing cost-to-complete reports.Review subcontractor and vendor payments and analyze subcontractor billings.Maintain necessary logs including change orders, field orders, submittals, RFIs, and more.Track materials used on the job site.Collaborate with the Vice President of Project Management to effectively manage projects.Coordinate payments with lower-tier vendors and subcontractors.Mentor and train Assistant Project Managers and Project Engineers.Participate in professional trade groups.

Qualifications/Experience

Bachelor's degree in civil engineering, construction management, or related field.Professional Certification.Registered Professional Engineer (preferred).5-10 years of experience as an Assistant Project Manager or Project Engineer.5+ years in heavy civil construction with Water/Wastewater Treatment Plant experience.

Competencies

Knowledge of Water/Wastewater Treatment Plant construction and systems.Ability to manage medium-sized projects.Strong negotiation skills.Understanding of project financial reporting and minority goals.Familiarity with contract documents and dispute resolution procedures.Leadership and management skills.Proficient written and verbal communication skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, P6, and Viewpoint software.Proactive, self-motivated, problem solver.

Position Type/Expected Hours Of Work

This is a full-time position, typically 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday. Flexibility is required to support time-sensitive issues as they arise, with an emphasis on meeting assigned responsibilities.

Work Environment

Work is primarily performed in a non-smoking office environment, with fieldwork and travel required. Overnight stays may be necessary depending on project demands.

Physical Requirements

Employees must be able to:

Sit (or stand) for prolonged periods.Occasionally lift up to 50 pounds.Occasionally bend, twist, squat, kneel, and walk up/down stairs.Demonstrate visual and hearing acuity.Work on outdoor construction sites with uneven terrain and in various weather conditions.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits

401(k) with matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insurance

Education: Bachelor's degree (Preffered)

Relocation assitance

To Apply, Please Include

Resume and project history

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
